intro: Pedicularis triangularidens subsp. triangularidens, commonly known as the triangular-leaved lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, characterized by its parasitic or hemiparasitic growth habit. The plant features showy, reddish-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are triangular in shape, giving it its common name, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. It is often found in alpine meadows and forested areas at high elevations.
